summary:
Europe is a continent in the Northern and Eastern Hemispheres, bordered by oceans and Asia. It's the second-smallest continent, covering about 10.18 million kmÂ². There are around 50 countries in Europe, with Russia being the largest. In 2021, Europe had about 745 million people, which is 10% of the world's population.

Europe's climate is mostly temperate, but it varies with distance from the sea. European culture is diverse, with roots in ancient Greece and Rome. The continent has a rich history, from the Roman Empire to the Renaissance and the Industrial Revolution. Europe's global influence has been significant, with colonial expansion and key roles in both world wars. Today, the European Union (EU) promotes integration and cooperation among European countries.
title: Europe
